column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/winning-with-jason-licht-the-turning-point-signing-part-i/|Winning With Jason Licht: The Turning Point Signing (Part I)|The NFL Scouting Combine kicks off tomorrow. The silly season of the offseason officially ramps up with team executives plotting
column4: misdirecting and investigating for the defining moves ahead. So Joe thinks this is a great time to roll out a multi-part series on Buccaneers Ring of Honor general manager Jason Licht. Joe’s talked to a lot of people about Licht with a focus on Licht’s defining moves that turned the Bucs into a Super Bowl champ and a lasting contender that’s since won four consecutive division titles. Joe asked new Raiders general manager John Spytek
column6: to share what he thinks was the Bucs’ most critical free agent move of the Licht regime not named “Tom Brady.” Licht set out to assess well-known failures
column7: overhaul the team mentality and step out of a norm
column8: Spytek said. The result was a slightly surprising move on the offensive line in March of 2018. “No. 1
column10: ” Spytek said with conviction. “When we were looking at what we wanted to get accomplished there — and it kind of like fit right with when we were really trying to organizationally and from a scouting standpoint trying to really self-assess
column11: be really self-aware about why had failed. “The free agent signings
column13: everyone was aware of the names that didn’t pan out. What were we missing? We were looking for somebody that was kind an enforcer. Somebody that had been through some sh*t in their life
column14: but from a life standpoint and a football standpoint
column15: and came from a great organization. Ryan Jensen fit that. “We made a decision there
column16: that had not been something we typically do
column17: dive in and pay the top of the market. We made him the highest paid center. And here’s a guy
column18: ‘Is he a guard? Is he a center? What is he?’ “I think that was the start of kind of the re-branding of the Bucs and who we became
column20: we’re-not-going-to-take-sh*t-from-anybody signing. “I thought without a doubt
column21: while he was here and he was healthy
column22: he was the best center in the NFL.” Spytek went on to say being the highest paid center meant something to Jensen and it wasn’t about the giant paycheck. Jensen was the right guy from the neck up. He was driven by that confidence shown by Licht
column23: and by fulfilling what Licht and the staff wanted from him. Tomorrow
column24: Joe will dive into another “re-branding” move by Licht

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/free-agency-countdown-14-days-the-bucs-and-donte-jackson/|Free Agency Countdown: 14 Days — The Bucs And Donte Jackson|A sect of Bucs fans runs through random Winn-Dixie aisles screaming about how if the Buccaneers cut Jamel Dean
column2: the team will save roughly $8.5 million in salary cap space next season. Dean has lost a lot of fans over the past couple of years. Between injuries
column3: a big salary and a lack of big plays
column4: many are ready to move on and thank the veteran Super Bowl cornerback for his service. Joe doesn’t rule out the Bucs re-negotiating Dean’s fat contract or flat out keeping him. Todd Bowles loves the guy. However
column5: a credible report had Dean on the trade block one year ago. Regardless
column6: the Bucs need a capable body at outside cornerback whether or not they keep brittle Dean. Bryce Hall was that guy last year but had a season-ending injury in Week 1. One guy on the market is veteran Donte Jackson. The Steelers traded for him last April and Jackson started 15 games and walked away with 5 interceptions. He’s a legit No. 2 cornerback who turns 30 in November. Bowles is no fan of shorter outside corners like Jackson (5-10) but Bowles is a fan of turnovers. Jackson has 19 career interceptions in seven seasons. For reference
column7: that’s as many as Dean and former Bucs cornerback Carlton Davis combined. Jackson won’t be cheap but he wouldn’t break the bank
column8: and the Bucs could do a lot worse opposite Zyon McCollum if they move on from Dean. The free agency frenzy kicks off on Monday
